meanings.sent1: The ball bounced off the wall.
meanings.sent2: She bounced the basketball on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The rubber ball bounced back and hit me on the nose!
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful voice bounced around the room like a happy echo.
meanings.sent5: The bouncing ball made a rhythmic sound that filled the gym.

meanings.sent1: The excited puppy bounced around the yard.
meanings.sent2: The kids bounced with joy when they heard the news.
meanings.sent3: She bounced out of bed, ready to start the day.
meanings.sent4: His heart bounced with anticipation as he waited for her answer.
meanings.sent5: The energetic music made everyone want to bounce on the dance floor.

meanings.definition: To be refused or returned, as a check.
meanings.sent1: The check bounced because there were insufficient funds.
meanings.sent2: He was surprised when his payment bounced back to him.
meanings.sent3: The bank notified her that the check had bounced due to an error.
meanings.sent4: The rejected check bounced back to the sender like a boomerang.
meanings.sent5: The bounced check served as a reminder to manage finances carefully.
